citeinfo.origin: Dale L. Taylor; Women in Natural Resource Magazine
citeinfo.title: The Proposed Beringian Heritage National Park

abstract.p: Beringia, that area of Alaska, Northwest Canada and the Russian Far East, has intermittently been a dryland connection between Asia and North America. Evidence of that connection remains today in the shared language, geneologies, cultural traditions and plant and animal communities that occur on both sides of the Bering Sea.
[Reference: Taylor, D.L. 1993. The Proposed Beringian Heritage National Park, Women in Natural Resource Magazine. 14(3): 45-47.]
This volume may be found at many university libraries.

descript.purpose: A view on Beringia and the proposed Beringian Heritage National Park.
